channel.title: Feeds.bbci.co.uk on Daytona 500 | The Great American Race
channel.description: Recent content in Feeds.bbci.co.uk on Daytona 500 | The Great American Race

item.title: 'I spent £2,000 on one event': Why Gen Z is obsessed with Hyrox
item.description: How young millennials and Generation Z - people in their twenties to early forties - have become obsessed with this fitness craze.

item.title: 'Major step': French MPs vote in favour of bill to ban social media for under-15s
item.description: If the bill passes the upper house it could take effect by the start of France’s new school year in September.

item.title: 'We're all terrified', Minnesotan tells the BBC in tears
item.description: The BBC’s Ana Faguy speaks to residents in the state after the second fatal shooting by federal immigration officers.

item.title: Analysing the Minneapolis shooting frame by frame
item.description: BBC Verify has analysed footage of the shooting from multiple angles, piecing together a detailed picture of what happened.

item.title: As the world inches back to a pre-WW2 order, the 'middle powers' face a grave new challenge
item.description: With economic stagnation and extremes of inequality comes corrosion of trust in democratic institutions. So Trump may be a symptom, not a cause, of what Carney called a “rupture” with the post-WW2 order.

item.title: China has purged its highest-ranked military general. Why?
item.description: Zhang Youxia had been seen as a close ally of China’s leader, Xi Jinping.

item.title: Could trilateral talks yield a breakthrough in Ukraine-Russia war?
item.description: It’s the first time representatives from Kyiv, Moscow and Washington have come together since the full-scale invasion of Ukraine in 2022.

item.title: Deadly US winter storm leaves flights delayed and thousands without power
item.description: At least a dozen people have died in multiple US states possibly due to the storm, officials have said.

item.title: Deadly winter storm grips large parts of the US
item.description: A powerful winter storm swept across the country, with heavy snow, ice and dangerously low temperatures affecting millions.

item.title: Eighteen dead after Philippines ferry with 300 passengers sinks
item.description: The local coast guard is still searching for 24 missing passengers of the MV Trisha Kerstin.

item.title: EU investigates Elon Musk's X over Grok AI sexual deepfakes
item.description: The Commission will assess whether “manipulated sexually explicit images” have been shown to users in the EU.

item.title: Former Olympian Ryan Wedding pleads not guilty to drug kingpin charges
item.description: The ex-Olympic snowboarder and accused cartel leader was taken into custody in Mexico last week by the FBI.

item.title: Greece biscuit factory fire leaves at least four dead
item.description: A search is continuing for one person still missing after a blaze broke out at a biscuit factory near the city of Trikala.

item.title: Gunmen storm Mexico football pitch and kill at least 11 people
item.description: The incident happened in Salamanca, a city particularly subject to gang-related violence.

item.title: Heatwave warnings across Australia as millions celebrate national day
item.description: Temperatures are expected to peak on Tuesday, reaching the “high forties” in Victoria and South Australia.

item.title: Immigration chief departing Minneapolis as Trump sends border tsar Tom Homan to scene
item.description: The decision may indicate that the administration is walking back more aggressive immigration enforcement.

item.title: Israel says it has retrieved remains of final Gaza hostage
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu called Ran Gvili’s return “an extraordinary achievement”.

item.title: Murder and MI5: How an extraordinary battle erupted over what the state keeps secret
item.description: Can the state, especially when it is implicated in killing, be trusted as the arbiter of what should remain confidential?

item.title: New Iran videos show bodies piled in hospital and snipers on roofs
item.description: Footage from a hospital in Tehran shows at least 31 bodies piled inside and seven body bags outside.

item.title: Nigerian officers to face trial over coup-plot allegations
item.description: Following an investigation some of the 16 detained last year are accused of planning to unseat President Bola Tinubu.

item.title: NRA and other US gun activists push back at Trump officials over Minneapolis shooting
item.description: The gun-lobby group, typically aligned with Trump, criticises a suggestion that those who carry guns risk being lawfully shot.

item.title: Private jet carrying eight people crashes in Maine
item.description: Poor visibility was reported at the airport during a winter storm that has affected a large swathe of the US.

item.title: Spain slashes speed limit on popular train route after fault found
item.description: The discovery of a crack on the Madrid-Barcelona line follows two recent deadly crashes in the country.

item.title: Tearful goodbyes as Japan returns pandas to China amid worsening ties
item.description: The twin cubs’ departure will leave Japan without any pandas for the first time since 1972.

item.title: Tech giants face landmark trial over social media addiction claims
item.description: Defendants include Meta, which owns Instagram and Facebook, TikTok’s owner ByteDance and YouTube parent Google.

item.title: Tributes pour in across India for revered BBC broadcaster Sir Mark Tully
item.description: Sir Mark Tully’s cremation was held on Monday in Delhi, where he lived even after leaving the BBC.

item.title: Trump abandons attack mode as Minneapolis shooting backlash grows
item.description: The White House has shifted how it talks about Alex Pretti’s killing as more Republicans express concern over the deadly encounter.

item.title: Trump raises US tariffs on South Korea imports to 25%
item.description: Trump has accused Seoul of “not living up” to a trade deal that was reached last year.

item.title: Uganda's military chief denies army assaulted Bobi Wine's wife
item.description: Barbara Kyagulanyi, married to the opposition leader, says she refused to reveal her husband’s whereabouts.

item.title: Watch: BBC at protests near scene where Alex Pretti was shot dead
item.description: Protesters chanted Alex Pretti’s name after he became the second person this month to be shot dead by federal agents in Minneapolis.

item.title: What India's Republic Day red carpet means for its foreign policy
item.description: Who sits beside India’s president on Republic Day signals Delhi’s diplomatic priorities to the world.

item.title: What we know about fatal shooting of Alex Pretti by federal agents in Minneapolis
item.description: Trump officials says federal agents shot in self-defence, as Pretti’s parents accuse them of “sickening lies”.

item.title: Who was Alex Pretti, the intensive care nurse shot dead in Minneapolis?
item.description: He has been described as an avid outdoorsman who loved mountain biking.
